intro: Astragalus keminensis, commonly known as Kemin milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its ecological importance lies in its ability to fix nitrogen, benefiting surrounding plant communities.
